text: Hey Team! When displaying a rich text property in `CrmPropertyList` , it seems like it can’t display stylings (e.g. bullets) properly. Is it expected? Is there anything I could have done differently?
Hi <@U04GLGWASUS>, this is correct, the `CrmPropertyList` does not support a full rich text editor viewing experience and will always display as plain text.
Thanks for confirming! <@U05ENUJF7B5>. Is there another component that displays rich text better?

<@U0718UK9ZG8> I agree with you! :slightly_smiling_face: What I meant by 'considering' is something we are actively looking to support, and may come soon, but we are not announcing the exact timeline.

<@U04GLGWASUS> if you're looking for a way to display bulleted lists specifically, I would recommend our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/list|List component>. Note that this is a standard component and might need more configuration than the CRM component.
I encourage you to stay posted on this using "In Development" category in product updates.
Heck yeah, I’m so here for it
Nice. What other pages would you like to have open for extensions?
Dashboard pages, object setting pages, and marketing events. Those are a couple of big ones for me
Ah totally forgot to mention the quote creation page, that’s the actual biggest one
Thanks. What helps here is also the use cases.
Heck yeah, I’ll shoot you a little write up for each
Thanks! Anyone else here, can send me use cases too. Comment over here or feel free setup a 15 min call

We have a custom time tracking / time billing system we built internally, so we want to surface that through custom UI in and around Tickets / Help Desk. The same system is also used for customer software asset management and quoting. We will be integrating that system with HubSpot Deals soon, so we may want / need custom UI around Deals and possibly Quotes (I'm not sure we need to reproduce the Quotes just yet, an attached PDF of the quote from our system, to the Deal might be all that's required).
